title: 114_s235
content: The Act titled "Wildfire Disaster Funding Act of 2015" authorizes funding for wildfire disasters. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to include provisions for wildfire suppression operations funding in the Wildland Fire Management accounts at the Department of Agriculture or the Department of the Interior. The adjustments for the fiscal year will be based on the additional budget authority provided for wildfire suppression operations, not exceeding a certain limit. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to include provisions for wildfire suppression operations funding in the Wildland Fire Management accounts at the Department of Agriculture or the Department of the Interior. The additional new budget authority for wildfire suppression operations shall not exceed specified amounts for fiscal years 2016 to 2020. For fiscal years 2021 to 2025, additional new budget authority is allocated for wildfire suppression operations: $2,320,000,000, $2,650,000,000, $2,690,000,000, $2,690,000,000, and $2,690,000,000 respectively. For fiscal years 2021 to 2025, additional new budget authority is allocated for wildfire suppression operations, defined as emergency and unpredictable aspects of wildland firefighting. For fiscal years 2021 to 2025, additional new budget authority is allocated for wildfire suppression operations, including support, response, emergency stabilization activities, and other emergency management activities. The average costs for wildfire suppression operations over the previous 10 years will be calculated annually and reported in the President's Budget submission. Amendments are made to the Disaster Funding section of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. Amendments are made to the Disaster Funding section of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. Starting in fiscal year 2018, the calculation of the 'average funding provided for disaster relief over the previous 10 years' will now include additional new budget authority for wildfire suppression operations. If supplemental appropriations are needed for wildfire suppression operations, the Secretary of the Interior or Agriculture must promptly submit a request and a plan to Congress within 30 days of availability.
